We requested a room change after the first night as we were right beside the lift and reception and we were woken quite a few times during the night (we have a 19 month old). The hotel was very accomodating & moved us without any issue.  This hotel is in a superb location.. just a few minutes walk from the hustle and bustle. There is a 7 Eleven metres away. All staff were extremely professional, polite & friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

6.review_text: stunning boutique hotel.  Our room 801 is nothing short of extraordinary. The design is opulence and luxury.  Have never stayed in a nicer room. the beautiful tiled on the floor. the half vaulted ceiling. The antique white louvre doors....  The location in Bangkok is perfect too. This hotel is unbelievable value too. we have run out of superlatives.

7.review_text: I recently stayed here for two weeks on really liked the hotel. Booking was easy and hassle free on their website and I believe good value.   Received a warm welcome, despite the rain outside. Booked a non smoking room and ended up with a 7th floor room, the room was clean and very comfortable and with an aircon that I could control (unlike my last hotel). The staff were very courteous and friendly and always greeted me with a smile. The laundry service was same day and was also very good. When in need of assistance (taxis etc) I found the staff most helpful. Some may think the mattress a little firm but that was fine for me, I have stayed at high level hotels where the matress was as hard as the floor itself but here it was firm but comfortable (unless you sleep on a soft…

8.review_text: good:  service, room size, location (close to everything) bad:  awful uncomfortable and lumpy bed and pillows.  little choice on TV.  air conditioning unit noisy and blew generally over beds.  food tasty, however very limited choice in hot foods (in fact, little western food other than v average croissants, toast and cereal.  hotel more suitable for business than leisure.

9.review_text: The hotel is clean and located at a good area. Right outside of the hotel is the Soi Thaniya, it cater specifically for Japanese and Japanese lover. Plenty of Japanaese restaurants, entertainment outlets and golf shop. Next to the hotel is The Boys Town where all the guys agogo bars are. Patpong is within a walking distance. The nearest BTS is Sala Daeng Station (about 5 minutes)

10.review_text: Previous comments have mentioned requests for non-smoking only to fin out the room stinks. Making u wait so they can spray air freshener before u go in is a give away. Got room upgraded apparently, looks the same to me, and it doesn't smell much better than the first. I would strongly advise not to stay here if u are a non-smoker.

11.review_text: A very well-located new hotel of some distinction. Service staff is top notch. Room is spacious, clean, tastefully decorated and quiet. Very comfortable pillows and good sound-proof room...very little noise though this hotel is situated quite close to the busy road. A nice and spacious car park too.... a rare commodity in space-tight Bangkok. Breakfast is nice but nothing special though the staff is very attentive and polite. I must say I am very comfortable with this hotel and will call Raya Surawong my new home whenever I visit Bangkok. Well done!

12.review_text: Good: value for money, room size, room servicing seemed efficient and kept clean, free bottled water, location if you want the nightlife of Silom, close to MRT and BTS so easy public transport.  Very helpful, friendly staff.  OK: Breakfast: limited selection but good options of fruit. Clearly catered for Japanese market.  Tiled floor is ok but be careful in socks or with wet feet. Slippery!  Bad: Smoke Smell: my room smelt of cigarette smoke and I had asked for nonsmoking. The lounge area out front of the lift was clearly setup for smoking, with open windows and an ash tray. Cigarette smoke can be smelt in the public areas.  Coffee at breakdast BAD. I went to Starbucks, which says something.  Massage guys next door hassling every time you enter or leave, but that's just BKK.

13.review_text: A modest front, but a great location. Excellent service and amazing rooms. I was really impressed with the price considering the pricing of other options around the area.  I would recommend for anyone who is looking for an amazing place at a competitive rate.

14.review_text: After reading all the good review on this hotel, finally decided to try out this hotel for 2 nights 916-18 July).    Reservation:  Excellence .. Ms. Aeung did a fantastic job by answering every single inquiries from me.  She is very helpful.  Reception:  Execellence - The two ladies at the reception are very good and welcoming.  They friendliness and smile will take away all your tiredness.  Room:  Great room - to me the room looks much better then the picture - as I am very particular in term of cleanliness, that's the first thing I look and the score a very high point on cleanliness.  Everything worked very well ...  Breakfast:  Simple and okay.  not many varieties and it seems that they cater more for Japanese  guest ... One the first day, the food tasted a little to salty…

15.review_text: We stay there 2 nights. The location is pretty close to salad Daeng BTS station and Lumpini Park, both within 5 min walk. My son went there twice a day for the animals there. The hotel is new, so everything is very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast is OK, not many choice but tasted good. The only downside is the Wi-Fi, slow sometimes.

1.review_text: My girl friend and I want to buy a cheap clothes in the morning at the Bo Bae market, so the nearest hotel to stay in is definitely Prince palace hotel. Cheap clean quiet and friendly staff. Highly recommended!

2.review_text: The receptionist was very polite and kind, and the room was very clean.  You can order dinner in the hotel or there are lots of restaurants around. The room was clean and we got also free snacks in the fridge

3.review_text: Hotel was fabulous!  Staff SUPERB Did a few tours from here. team excellent.  Area around not so great. No restaurants close Smelly food market close which spoilt our  time here in Bangkok. Such a shame. I wish someone had said within one of these forums

4.review_text: The hotel is in an excellent position to visit everything a tourist wants to see through the use of taxis and public transport.  It has spacious, clean rooms with all the comforts needed for a relaxing stay.  The view of bangkok from the higher rooms is fabulous especially in the evening.  The price-quality ratio is excellent

5.review_text: Nothing to write home about. Quite the opposite actually.. one thing has to be said straight from the get go: the staff are amazing! Incredibly friendly and happy to help at any given moment. The location of the hotel is alright. Not far from local markets but you’ll want to rent a taxi or yuk yuk regardless. The hotel itself is old. Really really old. The first thing you’ll notice is the smell of old, damp furniture as it hits you in the face like a brick wall. Like grandma never opens a window. The furniture and fittings also are quite old and I really hope you aren’t tall because you’ll be kneeling in the bathtub to have a shower. The room is clean enough and for just a couple nights is was fine. I’m sure there are more beautiful places to stay in Bangkok and the company is what counts, right?! Breakfast was superb!!!!…

6.review_text: Our comfort zone when we’re home was our bed. At Prince Palace, we stayed comfortably and feels like home. The buffet breakfast was great, the pool view was nice and the experience was one of a kind. Great location, near shopping malls and convenience stores.

7.review_text: Deceptively large hotel with a few different buildings.  Was upgraded to a suite when we arrived which was nice.  Rooms very dated, but lots of space and we even had a small kitchenette.  There is a restaurant on-site which we tried for dinner which was nice.  Breakfast was really nice, but pricey if not already included in the room price.  Didn't try the pool but was small for the size of the hotel, but never looked busy.  Great location.  Only negative was trying to get directions or a taxi somewhere.  Bellboy staff very unhelpful and reluctant to give us a map of the local area.  Hard to get reception staff to explain what is close etc. but that was a language barrier thing and not because they were unwilling to help.  All in all, a very good stay.

8.review_text: Fantastic view from restaurant.. nice food and good service. Clean room and daily cleaner. Swimming pool with bar. Seven eleven shop near the hotel. ATM machine and taxis near the entrance. Highly recommended hotel! :)

9.review_text: The entrance really amaze me with the gold and luxury look. The staffs very friendly and the service tip top. We enjoyed our three days there. The food also great. Amazing hotel to stay with your loved ones.

10.review_text: We didnt like it at all. Its like to visit grangrandmother's room who keeps everything since 1960. Shower was for very small people, windows cleaned few years ago.. Wont come back for sure and recommend to choose other hotels.

11.review_text: We were 2 couples, who stayed twice, a week apart, in the hotel (going and returning from another country). Both times we found the rooms clean and spacious; the staff friendly and helpful; the breakfast had a large selection to choose from; the restaurants had a good choice of food; and the pool and pool bar area inviting (although windy at times as it was on the 10th floor). The hotel is spread over 4 towers, so that, depending on which tower your room is in, there can be a bit of a walk and ride in lifts (each tower has its own) to the lobby and restaurants. This didn't bother us. Because of last minute rescheduling of our flights due to a leg of our journey being cancelled, on our return journey we had to arrive 2 days earlier than we had originally booked, and stay 3 nights…

12.review_text: Right in the heart of Bangkok. Amazing for amenities and tourism. Staff friendly, room very clean and maid was very polite. Pool area is just stunning and overlooks the skyline. Poolbar cocktails very nice around 300-450 baht per cocktail £8-£11. A great selections of restaraunts on site (I think around 8-9). The hotel is huge! There are 2 hotel towers at least 30 floors on each tower and the staff must work very hard to keep operations running smoothly.

13.review_text: We was in alot of accomodation in Thailand but this one need to be shut down and we never experience something like this. When we checked-in everything was ok, nice lobby and nice staff but things change when you stay a bit in your room. Everything is outdated, smelly room, dirty bathroom, windows but things are even worse when u find pubic hair in bathroom, around windows and bed where you need to sleep. We immediately call for manager to show him the room and he said he will give us another room. We went to check other room and sadly the things was same. We decided to leave hotel 1 hour after check-in and to be honest my dog have 10 times cleaner room and cleaner bed and I wouldn't let him to sleep there😷🤮

14.review_text: The entire team at Prince Palast was fantastic,very helpful,joyfull,the spirit that every hotel should have. greatly appreciated how kind everyone was to me especially thanks to Ms.Supaluk Noinar Iangaree (Front Clerk,Front Oficce)who helped me the most. Location perfect.Really nice View.Food very delicious,everyone should give it a try.clean rooms.I trully enjoyed my stay.Felt super confortabel and very welcomed there.for sure il come back when visit bangkok again.Great job guys.

15.review_text: I absolutely like this place! It's really fresh and nice view. It was absolute best massage I've ever had. Thank you Ms.Mod spa and everyone there is so pleasant, very welcoming. I'll visit there soon.

1.review_text: Hotel with modern interior, very friendly staff, in a good location. They have excellent coffee in the lobby!!! We stayed in an aprtma with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, very comfortable beds, amazing cleanliness and the room smelled beautifully. It is definitely worth a try swimming pool on 9th floors - on the roof of the hotel-beautiful panoramic view, from 4 p.m. you can use the pool bar. Svimming pool is open until 10 p.m. - it is brilliant!! Breakfast - so tasty!!

2.review_text: Perfect stay for 6 nights with our family (5 People). We really enjoyed it and the staff made everything to make us feel comfortable. The rooms are all really nice with a really nice style. They put some efforts in styling everything, what we really appreciate. The breakfast was good with lot of variety. We were missing a bit more of „fresh“ stuff (like more fruits) though.  The pool is really cool on the roof with an urban view - we loved it. A couple of trees or plants could help to make it look even more comfortable.

3.review_text: Positiv:  - Modern Rooms - Good Breakfast (but significantly more Asian dishes) - Good location  Negativ:  - Really bad smell in Room and especially the bathroom (Romm "510" and "212") - It´s very dark in the room (especially the bathroom) and the hall -

4.review_text: Very nice and clean rooms super service we booked a suite  We had a great stay. I cannot think more what to say of this super nice Hotel but Tripadvisor want me to make at least 200 signs. There was nothing not nice every thing was super staff is super friendly. So now i have more than 200 signs and can send this.

5.review_text: Nice and new hotel, close or Airport Rail Link and BTS station. We appreciated the up-grade room service and late check out service which met our need. Recommended for family travel. Free breakfast service with variety of choice for different age group.

6.review_text: I checked-in at this hotel at around 8 am despite the check-in time scheduled for 2 pm. The staffs' co-operation is commendable and I would like to extend my thanks to Oa the manager of the hotel for taking care of us and staff members, Ankush and the bellboy Jack along with other friendly members. Highly recommend this hotel.

7.review_text: I would recommend this hotel as a comfortable stay in Bangkok. Highlights were definitely the rooftop saltwater pool with jacuzzi and pool bar, comfortable beds in decent looking rooms on the higher floor levels, breakfast spread is delicious and a few items on the menu are changed everyday. The staff were fantastic and very helpful, even when there's a language barrier. Great hotel and would definitely return should i visit Bangkok again.

8.review_text: Things I liked:  1.  The hotel is new, stylishly nice and clean.  2.  It is conveniently located 500 meters from a BTS station, and 700 meters from another BTS station.  Public bus stations in and around the Victory Monument (about a 700 meters from the hotel) gives you other options.  3.  It is along a safe and lively Rangnam Street with at least a couple of 7/11s, numerous coffee shops, street food, restaurants, a shopping mall which had a night street food market, other nice hotels, and a green park where you can jog or just sit around.  There are also tuktuks and taxis waiting along the street (which I avoided at all cost as there is a BTS).  4.  Breakfast buffet was good and dishes changed daily.  I have a few observations though:  1.  SERVICE:  The drain in our shower was…

9.review_text: the property is very good and the location is also at a good location, staff is also very helpful and cooperative  especially Ankush was very helpful .  They especially arrange vegetarian food for us at the new year party  .

10.review_text: Excellent hotel with good location in Bangkok. Very good beds, air conditioning and bathroom.  The breakfast was good but I had hoped for a few more western choices. Still it was good however.  The personnel was really helpful and professional. Nice rooftop pool and bar as well.

11.review_text: The hotel has a great location, easy to reach the touristical places and the airport also.  The rooms are big and comfortable. The breakfast is excellent and gives a great variation of the different options. The staff is very helpful however their English is not the best.

12.review_text: Beautiful hotel, grate stuff- polite, kind, helping in any way, clean, providing water in the room. Grate breakfast It is worth to stay here 🙏🏻 They have the service of keeping the baggage if needed, for free.

13.review_text: Location was very good.all staff's were very friendly and very helpful specially Mr. Sam and Jack and Ankush which make the stay very pleasant. Hotel facilities were good. Need to add Halal food in the menu.

14.review_text: Giving this hotel thumbs up for their big spacious and clean room, bed was so comfortable, I had very good rest. 2nd time staying here during my Bangkok tour, easy to move around, BTS Victory station is walking distance, I took it to Siam Paragon and many good food outlets nearby. Kings Power is round the corner. Keep up the good work, Mr OA and team. Will stayed again if I come back to Bangkok.?

15.review_text: The staffs were truly helpful and friendly. The staffs always approach to you for help. Truly appreciate and grateful for their effort and help. They do explain everything in detailed and clearly. The room was big, clean and comfortable. It’s a great stay!

1.review_text: Thailand is my second home! For nth time, I visited the country during the last quarter of 2019 to attend a very special event of my Alma mater. Being an official delegate for the said occasion, I got free accommodation for entire duration of the event. The main event was held at the hotel and all the delegates from other Asian countries were booked here. The hotel is one of the oldest hotels located at the outskirt of Bangkok but it is accessible to the old airport, Don Muang and could be considered as one of the best ones two decades ago!  he organizer chose the hotel since it is more convenient to reach my Alma mater in Pathumthani, away from the heavy traffic of the metropolis.   The hotel's entrance gate is along the main highway but the main lobby of the hotel is bit far, and still need for the vehicle or taxi to move about 200 meters to reach the building. The hotel has a spacious lobby and have sofas for guest and visitors to sit. It has a bar adjoining the lobby and the dining area where the breakfast is serve. As we all know, Thai food is excellent and there were a lot of good choices of food - main course to desserts, drinks to fruits. The hotel has several function rooms to cater a huge number of guests. Unfortunately, I missed its swimming pool!  I was fortunate to occupy the big room (with two single beds) by myself. The room is spacious compare to other hotels that I have stayed in Asia which is very ideal for family affair. However, despite the availability of basic amenities of the room, it was a surprise for me to found out that the "wifi" connection is "not free", or rather was not included in the accommodation which is very unusual for a hotel. In other words, internet service is an added expense on top of the accommodation.   Being a traveller or a tourist, communication is very essential and internet connection is the easiest and fastest way to keep connected and updated with friends, colleagues and families. I personally asked the front manager, and it was explained to me that the organizer did not include internet connection to our accommodation. What made me feel disappointed with the hotel management, was that the hourly rate for the wifi is very expensive as one time login only - which means that the time is clicking even you are not using the service.   If I will be given another chance to visit Bangkok, choosing Rama Gardens will be my last option!…

2.review_text: I spent 5 days with my sister there and we really enjoyed the whole stay. Very friendly and pleasant staff, beautiful swimming pool and garden, variety of food selection. We tried all restaurants there and food was great. Most of all, always smiling and kind staff made out stay more enjoyable. Especially thanks to Ms Kittipong at front desk.

3.review_text: I had a 2 days business meetings and the booking was in this hotel.. the hotel is relatively old it's near the old Duan Mung airport. The hotel is very large in space, it has many facilities like a football playground, swimming pools, herbal garden, meeting rooms, convention rooms and wedding rooms. The hotel room is not so big, the furniture is ok and the bed is comfy.. Breakfast was not so good. The normal Thai hotel breakfast.. but still you can eat .. the good about this hotel is that you can walk for a long time among the trees and the good weather. Out of 10 I can give 7 to this hotel.

4.review_text: On entry. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are excellent and well maintained.The ambience and friendliness in most staff is very good but downhill there.  1. During the night. I tried to order food to my room. Called repeatedly but unable to reach. So called operator who transferred me to the same number which I could not connect in the first place. Finally walked down myself to order and found that almost 75% of their menu wasn't available. Anyway, the food was ok  2. In the morning, there are two breakfast venues. If we are on the club floors, really recommend it since the breakfast is high quality and good. But on the second day, we are forced to eat at the regular breakfast area where the food is cold,baked beans are like boiled in water. Coffee has only one option and I had an espresso the day before but today needed to pay for it. Finally the staff had the audacity to inform that we have been moved since they don't have enough guests and it's not profitable for them to have a better breakfast. Keep in mind, we are paying a premium to enjoy a better experience but are not receiving it.…

5.review_text: Only good place for MICE but not for relax or travelers. Staff are not friendly definitely Operator girl on the afternoon shift, very very bad attitude, no service mind while I'd called to front deck but dialing wrong number I have been replied by frustrated sound from that operator girl no any greetings as hospitality standard of service sequence  . I'm  just sharing my experience while staying here.

6.review_text: Large hotel ,full facilities, taxi to central plaza Ladprow about 70baht Return taxi about 120 baht for U turn   A lot of conference rooms .Breakfast is very normal .the room is spacious and clean . Toilet is clean. Wifi is 300 baht .

7.review_text: I  booking by agoda app before entry to hotel just 15 minutes.Everything ok, Receptionist accept my voucher. I request twin room but she sent me to double room. By the way, Receptionist change room for me. Room was large, clean and full of facilities ,2 bottle water+ hair dryer as basic. This is good choice near Donmuang Airport.

8.review_text: A bit out of town, but easy to access to the big weekends market by taxi. Good room and nice setting. Food are great. A good hotel for taking good rest. Taxi sometimes is a bit of waiting. Overall a good hotel.

9.review_text: Very clean rooms. Good restaurants/5.  Convention Hall is updated. But some parts are not. Not close to the Airport. Located on a “Interstate”. This place is moderate and many other hotels might be more suitable.

10.review_text: A wonderful hotel not too far from Don Meung. We stayed a week and would gladly stay again. The beds were perfect, air con was powerful. And the food!!! Wow. Loved the food. The bread was beautiful and tasted great. Can not recommend this place enough.

11.review_text: Hello, I was in BKK last weekend for a Business Gala Dinner. I decided not to bring any of my curlers and straighteners to give me hair some time to rest and breathe. I figured I should go to a salon to get my hair washed and styled instead.   Upon arrival, I got a brochure at the reception counter. They had a salon in the hotel itself called Kann Kar. And there was Rama Gardens name on it, so I figured it was probably their in house Salon and I would have trusted their salon more than any others which are on the streets.   It says 300 baht on the brochure but when I went to the salon she wanted to charge me 500 baht. Which was fine with me, I just needed to get my hair done for dinner.   I went for my appointment and she wanted to skip the hair wash. When I reminded her, she…

12.review_text: nice and good , clean room, swimming pool and great Gym, good environment, the staff were not that friendly, morning breakfast is not vegetarian-friendly, staff just stand, repeatedly requested for a hot coffee, but no response from the staff in charge, the coffee pot was on the heater but the heater was not working, not taken care of.

13.review_text: About 10-15 minutes to Don Mueang Airport by taxi depends on traffic condition. Approx 150 baht.  Large hotel with a few good outlets.  Staff were helpful and friendly but management needs to review check in and out peak hours as service could improve with a few more staff during peak hours.  Rooms, fittings and furnishing are dated but beds and pillows are comfortable. TV is modern flat screens. Junior suite I was upgraded to was large and had a nice but also dated bathroom.  Had my dinner at Camomile bar I think. The staff were nice and friendly. The duo who performed the music were fantastic. They both had great voice. Initially I had the place to myself enjoying my dinner, the live music as well as the attention by the duo. The played Bee Gees and hit my chord. Lovely voices…

14.review_text: Stayed here for one night. The room is spacious and clean. Amenities smell good. The hotel is quite big and also have Chinese and Japanese restaurants.   We tried their Japanese restaurant which was not too pricey and the food was good.  Recommend if you need to stay in Don Muang area.

15.review_text: Please be careful while drinking or eating any thing at the room from the refrigerator , because at the time of check out you need be surprised when they will give you the bill. I had worst experience and paid approx 1200 THB for the sake of mini bar which i did not even drink that much. They prepared the bill how they liked it . When i told to the receptionist that i did not drink and its in the refrigerator but they kept on insisting me to pay whatever they mentioned on bill.  Rooms were stinking and lights were even not working . Please be careful before you book this hotel , specially with receptionist who even dont care your concerned.

1.review_text: Hotel offer complimentary tuk tuk service to BTS station. In between great locations, short walk to Lumpini park, chidlom bts, Mercury ville   Room, facilities were clean with good facilities provided in the room. Fully equipped with kitchen equipment such as cutlery, dishes, pots, toaster so on.  Loved their shower gel and complimentary mini bar vending machine in the lounge.

2.review_text: The hotel is strategically located in Bangkok with shopping malls and eateries such as Central Chidlom, Mercury Ville, Central Embassy, Velaa Sindhorn Village, etc easily accessible within walking distance.  We stayed in a one bedroom suite with kitchenette for almost 3 months. I’ve been doing my regular grocery shopping conveniently either at Central Foodhall or Villa Market.   Each and every team member of the hotel from front desk, to housekeeping, to reservation, to sports & recreation, tuk tuk transport, engineering & maintenance etc. has been warm, helpful and diligent throughout our stay which we appreciate their hospitality.  We would definitely return to stay at the hotel when we are back in Bangkok.

3.review_text: I am not sure about the receptionist name but if i am not wrong is Sofie. She was greating us so profesional and a warm welcome. The hotel also gave us a beyound service. We got a birthday cake and a small gift which we were not expecting that they would know my birthday. The room was tidy,neat and clean. We checked out with the manager Mr.Kayyasit who also gave me a warm farewel. I really recommend this place if you have a vacation or business travel in the Bangkok city centre.

4.review_text: Clean and spacious room. Well equipped kitchenette.  Convenient location with complimentary tuktuk service to BTS station after which one can walk to Central World.  Bunk beds would be better if it's less squeaky.

5.review_text: It’s not a luxurious hotel but a very “practical” one! The room is very spacious with a kitchenette.  It’s well maintained, clean and tidy!  Complimentary coffee as well as iced drink is served at the lobby.  The location is convenient. bts station and shopping area is within walking distance.  Staff is very responsive in providing assistance.

6.review_text: I have stayed in other Centre Point Hotels for number of times. It is my first time stayed in Chidlom. The hotel is not really that close to the BTS but if you are carrying a small bag then it is fine. If you are have a large suitcase you can simply call the Hotel and they will send the Tuktuk to pick you up somewhere close to the BTS. The staff in the front desk are excellent and very very helpful. One of the lady spent a lot of time helping me to find my parcels. The housekeeping staff are also excellent as they know what you need in your room. My entire stay there was excellent except the shower pressure was quite low and some of the stuff there may need to be fixed. I will be happy to stay there again for my next trip.

7.review_text: The hotel room was very spacious and despite both of us having a big luggage each, there was plenty of room for us to move around. The bed was very comfortable. There was even a couch in the room where we could lounge on.  Surprisingly, there was also a kitchenette, which we were not expecting since it was not an apartment suite. No complaints though, because we love how we could bring back loads of food and drink to the room.  The staff at the concierge were very helpful as well, especially when we were seeking directions. They used their computers to search for directions to places which they did not know as well.  The only drawback was that the hotel was about a 10-15 minutes walk from BTS Chidlom Station (Exit 4). and the path along the way was a little unsteady due to the…

8.review_text: Located on Soi Lang Suan, between the Lumphini park and Soi Sukhumvit (Chidlom), Centre point hotel Chidlom is my new favorite place to stay during my short visits in Bangkok. First of all, I love the area where the hotel is located, Soi Lang Suan is a living street with many locals working in the Bank/Financial sector and you feel not stressed by too many tourists or bars that can be sometime annoying for travellers looking for something more quiet in the heart of Bangkok. The hotel is really well managed; the staff is very friendly and professional. I have nothing to say about the accommodation: the air conditioned room is provided with everything you need (I really appreciate the kitchen corner of the executive suite), the bathroom is very functional and the comfort of the…

9.review_text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and we totally enjoyed our stay! The room was spacious enough although the TV screen could be a bit bigger and the decor needed update, customer services were top notch (very responsive and attentive). The pool was a bit cold due to not heated, not ideal if you want to do some laps, there was a library with good selection of books, the gym equipments were good although the treadmills need some services. Our room had microwave and stove top and big fridge and utensils if you would like to cook, there wasnt a washing machine but you can buy a token at front desk for 95 baht for laundry facilities which was located at the basement. Hotel location was ok, walking from the hotel to Centrel World was doable (15 min walk), hotel offers tuk tuk…

10.review_text: From the warm smiles at the entrance by the security guards and bellboy, to the understanding of your needs at reception,the staff here transcend the experience to one of a really exceptional hotel.  Highly recommended.

11.review_text: I had an enjoyable stay here. The breakfast was very good.  The pool was quiet, very relaxing. You could watch and hear the rain and enjoy your swim. The room was big enough and the housekeeping did a very good job.

12.review_text: The hotel is located at Chidlom, where walking to the BTS is around 10 min.  However, there is free tuk-tuk service between certain hours so you do need to walk if the weather is hot.  The room is very clean and spacious, it also comes with a lot of amenities such as a small kitchen and bidet in the toilet.  The service was the best I have ever experienced; knowing that it was my husband birthday, they surprised us with a slice of cake and a small souvenir.  I am very impressed by their service and would definitely stay again when I am back in Bangkok.

13.review_text: I was stay at low floor (6floor) and seems their room not really up to date by the design and etc. the light was absolutely not enough even for make up. The room looks more like service apartments instead of 4 star hotel.  For the location, I’ve to say this hotel is located in a Very good location and convenient access to all you needs but I feel that the facilities still not enough also in common area. The swimming pool was ok. The sauna room was little bit too small and they should have steam room too.

14.review_text: The front desk staffs tried the best to help us meet our requests. There are many different food for breakfast. A free tuktuk shuttle from BST Chid Lom station to the hotel. And I will come back soon.

15.review_text: Really great location, easy to get to. Rooms were nice, very spacious. The staff were all great and really helpful. I liked that we got credits to use the vending machine downstairs. Although when booking a Grab taxi, for some reason the address takes them to the opposite side of the road. The only slightly negative thing I would say is that the breakfast buffet isn't great in its selection.
